violations.name: vpc_endpoint
violations.vulnerability: Security Groups Unrestricted Specific Ports https (TCP,443) is exposed to private hosts more than 32.
violations.remediation:
In AWS Console - 
 1. Sign in the AWS Console and go to the Amazon VPC console.
 2. In the navigation pane, select Security Groups.
 3. For each security group, perform the following actions:
      a) Select the security group.
      b) Select the Inbound Rules.
      c) Identify the rules to be removed.
      d) Remove the .
 4. Click Save.
violations.policyName: Accurics Security Best Practices for AWS v2
violations.ruleDisplayName: Ensure Security Groups Unrestricted Specific Ports https (TCP,443) is not exposed to private hosts more than 32

violations.name: this
violations.vulnerability: VPC flow logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC.
violations.remediation:
In AWS Console - 
 1. Sign in to the AWS Console and go to the VPC dashboard.
 2. In the navigation pane, select a VPC.
 3. Select the Flow Logs tab.
 4. If no Flow Log exists, select Create Flow Log.
 5. Set the filter to Reject.
 6. Enter a Role and Destination Log Group.
 7. Select Create Log Flow.
 8. Select a CloudWatch Logs Group.
violations.policyName: Accurics Security Best Practices for AWS v2
violations.ruleDisplayName: Ensure VPC flow logging is enabled for all AWS VPCs
